de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.datageneration.filltype
Class FillType

java.lang.Object
  de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.datageneration.filltype.FillType

public class FillType
extends java.lang.Object

This abstract class represents the type of filling any MetaAttribute with valuable data. Because there are a bunch of possibilities to do the job properly a strategy pattern is used at the basic level.

Strategy pattern defines a family of algorithms, encapsulates each one, and makes them interchangeable. Strategy lets the algorithm vary independently from clients that use it.

Since:
Apr/20/09
Version:
0.1
Author:
Michael Munz

Constructor Detail

FillType

public FillType()
sole default constructor

Method Detail

setFillBehaviour

public void setFillBehaviour(FillBehaviour fb)
sets the filling algorithm. This part is interchangeable and is independent from the client. This makes it flexible enough to change the strategy at runtime.

Parameters:
fb - algorithm to handle filling

getFillBehaviour

public FillBehaviour getFillBehaviour()
gets the filling strategy. Depending on the strategy filling could be done several ways. It's also possible to change the strategy at runtime. This happens, when the tester decides to use a different algorithm to handle the filling.

Returns:
filling behaviour

getValueAt

public java.lang.String getValueAt(int n)
this method is a pass through and is for convenience only. You could instead get the fill strategy and get the value by calling getValueAt(n) manually.

Parameters:
n - the value at index n to fetch
Returns:
the value as a string object or null

getN

public int getN()
this method is a pass through to the strategy and returns this value. It is just for convenience. You could also return the strategy by getFillBehaviour() and then call getN().

Returns:
total amount of available values
See Also:
FillBehaviour.getN()

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
gets the name of the strategy currently selected. This is for displaying purposes only.

Returns:
name of current strategy.
